learning_objectives: Understand and differentiate between Earth's rotation and revolution
Observe how Earth's rotation causes the cycle of day and night
Explain how Earth's revolution and axial tilt cause the seasons
Visualize the Earth's orbit and axis inclination in a simplified model
Apply knowledge to predict day/night and seasonal changes based on Earth's position
key_concepts: Rotation: Earth spins on its axis (24 hours)
Revolution: Earth orbits the Sun (365.25 days)
Axial tilt: Earth's axis is inclined at ~23.5 degrees
Orbit: Elliptical path around the Sun
Day and night caused by rotation
Seasons caused by revolution + axial tilt
simulation_logic: Initialize Earth at default position with Sun at center
Draw Earth with visible axis line showing tilt angle
Apply rotation: update Earth's spin angle based on rotationSlider value
Apply revolution: position Earth along circular orbit based on revolutionSlider value
Render day/night: illuminate hemisphere facing Sun, darken opposite side
Render seasons: highlight hemisphere receiving more direct sunlight based on tilt and position
Update time display: calculate local time based on rotation angle
Handle user interactions: update simulation state when sliders/buttons change
Loop: continuously redraw with updated positions and lighting
mobile_ui_plan: Vertical scroll layout optimized for mobile screens
Header with title and brief description
Canvas element taking full width for simulation visualization
Control panel below canvas with sliders and buttons
Information panel showing current values and explanations
Responsive design: controls stack vertically, canvas scales with screen size
Touch-friendly: large slider handles and button sizes
misconceptions_to_address: Believing seasons are caused by Earth's distance from Sun (not tilt)
Thinking day and night are caused by the Sun moving around Earth
Assuming Earth's orbit is highly elliptical (it's nearly circular)
Not understanding that axial tilt direction remains constant during revolution
text_instructions_for_students: Welcome! This simulation shows how Earth moves and why we have day/night and seasons.
Use the Rotation Speed slider to spin Earth faster or slower.
Use the Revolution Position slider to move Earth around the Sun.
Adjust the Axial Tilt slider to see how the tilt affects seasons.
Click 'Toggle Day/Night View' to see which side is in daylight.
Click 'Toggle Seasons View' to see which hemisphere gets more sunlight.
Press 'Reset' to start over with default settings.
Tip: Try changing one slider at a time to see its effect!
safety_constraints: All visualizations are simplified models for educational purposes
Not to scale: distances and sizes are exaggerated for clarity
Sun representation is symbolic - do not look directly at real Sun
No personal data collection or external network requests
